how do i chage network setting: what is you want to do?
probably the best method is to list the cards in /etc/network/interfaces
if the machine is fairly static and the addresses will not change then this method is very reliable and maintenance free but does involve editing a couple of config files
ok i will make change pls tell me what are change is require
one of the cards will be connected to a gateway/router?
run sudo ifconfig -a, you should see both cards listed as eth{number}, you need to work out which one is connnected to your gateway
or which one you WANT to be connected to your gateway
ok and the other is eth0?
do you have a preference for dns servers?
ok cool, you need to put your preferred nameservers in /etc/resolv.conf in the format: nameserver x.x.x.x where x.x.x.x is the nameserver IP address
when you've done that you need to edit the /etc/network/interfaces file with root priveleges, you can use your choice of text editor!
